posts.post_content:
The best combo I can come up with is:  
  
T1: [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko) ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)  
T2: [Cephalid Illusionist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Illusionist) ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)  
T3: [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) + [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe) (or wait a turn)  
  
Low, flexible mana costs, all in the same color. The cards are cheap too ($0.19 for the Cephalid, $0.49 for Shuko, $1.00 for Laboratory Maniac at the time of this post).
posts.html:
The best combo I can come up with is:

T1: Shuko
T2: Cephalid Illusionist
T3: Laboratory Maniac + Gitaxian Probe (or wait a turn)

Low, flexible mana costs, all in the same color. The cards are cheap too ($0.19 for the Cephalid, $0.49 for Shuko, $1.00 for Laboratory Maniac at the time of this post).

Posted By: Dnn (1/13/2012 5:40:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: For those of you thinking of using this in combination with [Thought Lash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thought Lash) might I suggest [Lantern of Insight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lantern of Insight)? Lets see what you're about to exile before you exile it, and if you draw a second lantern, you can use it to disrupt your opponent's deck (by causing them to shuffle) Throw in a couple of {U} draw spells (instant speed is key!) and you've got yourself a genuine combo deck. Additionally, you can use [Future Sight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Future Sight) to have the top card of your library revealed, or if you're looking for something with more control aspect, [Sphinx of Jwar Isle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of Jwar Isle). For those of you that are *really* maniacs...there are some {B} instants that allow risky tutoring, things like [Demonic Consultation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Consultation) or [Spoils of the Vault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spoils of the Vault) would work, just make sure you name something that isn't in your deck. Although with Spoils you'd need some way to prevent the life loss.
posts.html:
For those of you thinking of using this in combination with Thought Lash might I suggest Lantern of Insight? Lets see what you're about to exile before you exile it, and if you draw a second lantern, you can use it to disrupt your opponent's deck (by causing them to shuffle) Throw in a couple of {U} draw spells (instant speed is key!) and you've got yourself a genuine combo deck. Additionally, you can use Future Sight to have the top card of your library revealed, or if you're looking for something with more control aspect, Sphinx of Jwar Isle. For those of you that are really maniacs...there are some {B} instants that allow risky tutoring, things like Demonic Consultation or Spoils of the Vault would work, just make sure you name something that isn't in your deck. Although with Spoils you'd need some way to prevent the life loss.

posts.post_content:
When you burn someone to death, you get an image of your opponent being immolated.  
When you kill someone with a creature, you think of them getting mauled.  
When you mill yourself out, the game ends, the screen turns to black,  
  
and all you hear is maddening laughter...  
  
Its the things you don't see that scare you the most.
posts.html:

When you mill yourself out, the game ends, the screen turns to black,

and all you hear is maddening laughter...

Its the things you don't see that scare you the most.

posts.post_content:
So there's the [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko)/[Cephalid Illusionist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Illusionist) combo, the [Demonic Consultation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Consultation) combo, the [Paradigm Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradigm Shift) combo...  
  
So here's a new one, particularly for EDH: [Tunnel Vision](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tunnel Vision) + [Soldevi Digger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soldevi Digger)  
  
Play the Digger, put the top card from your library to the bottom of the library. Play Tunnel Vision, targeting the one card, leaving your deck with 1 card.   
  
Either wait the turn, or use something like [Gush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gush) and win.  
  
It's just a real shame that Laboratory Maniac isn't a legendary creature, like Ludevic or someone. Although, you'd be able to win on turn 4 if you played him then [Paradigm Shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradigm Shift).
posts.html:
So there's the Shuko/Cephalid Illusionist combo, the Demonic Consultation combo, the Paradigm Shift combo...

So here's a new one, particularly for EDH: Tunnel Vision + Soldevi Digger

Play the Digger, put the top card from your library to the bottom of the library. Play Tunnel Vision, targeting the one card, leaving your deck with 1 card.

Either wait the turn, or use something like Gush and win.

It's just a real shame that Laboratory Maniac isn't a legendary creature, like Ludevic or someone. Although, you'd be able to win on turn 4 if you played him then Paradigm Shift.

posts.post_content:
T1: island, [sol ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sol ring)  
T2: swamp, [demonic consultation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=demonic consultation), him, then [gitaxian probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gitaxian probe)  
  
or if you want a more *casual setup*:  
  
T1: same as above  
T2: plains, him, [tormod's crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=tormod's crypt)  
their turn: play [silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=silence)  
T3: exile your graveyard,[paradigm shift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=paradigm shift) then probe.  
  
or you could just mill yourself to victory... that works too.

posts.post_content:
@ IUseBreakOpen  
  
I'll do you one better. This one is from an article on MTGSalvation.  
Turn one [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko).  
Turn two [Cephalid Illusionist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cephalid Illusionist), deck yourself until at least one [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), one [Azami, Lady of Scrolls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azami, Lady of Scrolls), one [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac), one [Angel of Glory's Rise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Glory's Rise), and at least two [Narcomoeba](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Narcomoeba) end up in your yard. In fact for this to work, just empty the damn thing. You target Angel with the return, which recurs the Azami and the Maniac. If you've gotten this far in the combo, you cannot lose.
posts.html:
@ IUseBreakOpen

I'll do you one better. This one is from an article on MTGSalvation.
Turn one Shuko.
Turn two Cephalid Illusionist, deck yourself until at least one Dread Return, one Azami, Lady of Scrolls, one Laboratory Maniac, one Angel of Glory's Rise, and at least two Narcomoeba end up in your yard. In fact for this to work, just empty the damn thing. You target Angel with the return, which recurs the Azami and the Maniac. If you've gotten this far in the combo, you cannot lose.
